law.catch_line: Requirements For Other Group Annuity Contracts

text.section: A group annuity contract shall not be delivered in the commonwealth unless the commissioner finds that:
the issuance of the group annuity contract is not contrary to the best interests of the public;
the issuance of the group annuity contract would result in economies of acquisition or administration; and
the benefits are reasonable in relation to the premiums charged.
The premium for the annuity contract shall be paid either from the contract holderâ€™s funds or from funds contributed by the covered persons, or from both.
